website_summaries.verdict: With its ultraslim profile, the Asus Zenbook UX305FA-ASM1 midrange ultraportable certainly redefines the concept of thin. Unfortunately, its performance isn't as impressive.
pros: Fanless design, thanks to Intel Core M processor
All-day battery life in our tests

customer_reviews.title: Broken almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I bought a brand new ASUS Zenbook and it only turned on once after unboxing. The next day it ceased to work (after closing the lid on it for the night, leaving it charged). The charging light appeared orange, and then green once it was fully charged, but when I press the power button, the only perceptible behavior is a tinny whirring, and the tiny LEDs under the power, caps lock, and airplane mode buttons to light up and fade out a few seconds later.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Performant and nice, light laptop when it works
customer_reviews.text: Nice, very performant laptop. Unfortunately: 1) Purchased in Dec 2015, by June it stopped working. I had to pay $30 to ship if via FedEx to Asus for repairs. Was without a laptop for weeks. Sent it back to me repaired. At the beginning of November stopped working again. Another $30 for FedEx? Why doesn't Asus pay for shipping to and from their repair facility? Isn't the warranty supposed to be totally cost free to the owner? At this rate I am out $60 and almost two months (out of 11 months) out of a computer. Next time I am going for a Lenovo or a Microsoft Surface or something. Their customer service is rather rude too.
customer_reviews.author: Oddo

customer_reviews.title: recommended
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews on this laptop. I had it for a little over a year now. PROS - very light seems pretty sturdy, it can hold few bumps here and there incredibly fast in reboot or startup thanks to the SSD Hard Drive best bang for the buck in its category looks rad CONS - performance: nothing impressive, still fairly good for a laptop the touchpad is just a piece of crap, period.
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: It's a good laptop for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good laptop for the price, but just know the main cons: The display driver crashes ALL the time. This computer can't handle videos or multiple browsers open at the same time. I've had their tech support walk me through a couple different things like updates and system refreshes, but it still happens. I googled it, and apparently, it's not just my computer. The speakers are pretty sad. Why would Bang & Olufson put their name on these speakers. I usually have to watch TV shows and movies with subtitles. This is a tiny complaint, but the trackpad isn't that responsive, and the mouse clicks are really loud. Pros: small and light. battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck, by far!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a detailed review, I can't do better than Anandtech:  In short: When you see an ultrabook with 8Gb of RAM, 256 Gb SSD, for way less than 1000 usd for the first time in history, you have no choice but buying it. ultralight and portable, 8-10 hours of battery life, completely silent (no fan, and no HDD) and amazing performance. You can't get anything better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Abelardo A. Rodriguez-Trilla

customer_reviews.title: Zenbook is very Zen LIke.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I upgraded from an I5 with a regular harddrive. The zenbook brings Zen to my life with its super fast bootup. It is seconds from power on to productivity. It is lightweight and has great battery life. When i pick up other laptops in the house, I feel like I am lifting weights. This thing is superlight. Performance wise, it rocks. 10-15 windows open and it doesn't hesitate. The only thing I had to get used to was windows 8 from 7. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kailash Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Great for College Students
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - SSD - Great Keyboard - Size - Weight - Screen - Ports Cons: - Touchpad - Speakers For college, buy a mouse and some headphones. You'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Akin

customer_reviews.title: A laptop that is thin, attractive and very useful.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop immediately set itself up with some questions to the user, was able to quick add programs and needs for my business travels like the manner it handles. Read many reviews about this laptop and for the most part it sold me on getting this ultra size and weight for my personal and business needs. The mouse pad comments read about worked well for me and sensitive to movements correctly. There are more review that are more technical and read those and more independently on the internet for the most part this product sold me and expect it to do well as I travel. There is no perfect machine but this one is very close.
customer_reviews.author: LJB

customer_reviews.title: High quality computer for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome! After reading online reviews, and sourcing Consumer Reports for confirmation we purchased this item for my teenage son, who needed a laptop for school. The device is carted back and forth to school, daily, in his back pack. It has been 2 months and not a single complaint. It is very fast, light weight and powers on quickly. We highly recommend it. If there was one feature we could add, it would be backlit keys, but hey, it's much less expensive than a MacBook. We feel completely satisfied with the purchase and recommend this computer without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Heatseaker

customer_reviews.title: excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, excellent battery life. These are the things you want in an ultrabook. Processor is sufficient for the things people actually use ultrabooks for; I probably push it harder than most by running a few VMWare sessions, but it is quite usable even then. The micro-HDMI connector is a little fussy when you're using an external monitor, and I wish they'd included USB-C and a microphone connector -- even a TRRS connector for phone earbuds would have been an excellent addition!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: So Sad
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst laptop I have used in my entire life. Screen display goes off frequently. Poor image/video display. Very poor wifi connectivity. Mostly one or two bars of wifi connectivity and it goes off completly in most instances. Hard touch buttons. It can't even be upgraded to windows 10 bcos of compatibility problems. The list goes on and on. I threw my 700 box away. I will never buy or recommend such a j****** laptop to any of my friends of my entire generation. Shame on the designers of this good looking but poor product.
customer_reviews.author: NAA

customer_reviews.title: Good for doing things with!
customer_reviews.text: Like internet. And typing. And holding it in front of your face while you behold the astounding complex nature of what it actually is. I prefer the aluminum body over all polycarbonates simply because the thought of Earth ore on my lap makes me happier than refined ancient decomposed organic compounds. Also, the TPU is NICE! High five Intel. Set battery saver to always be on.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Omiotek

customer_reviews.title: I can say this thing is really nice. The core-m series is more than capable of ...
customer_reviews.text: After using the UX305 for over a week now, I can say this thing is really nice. The core-m series is more than capable of doing full fledged computer stuff: excel, web browsing, media consumption. I've even played some Dota 2 on it. Only thing is that it's already developed a wear spot on the track pad. At first I thought it was skin oil, but I tried cleaning it with some isopropyl, but the spot is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: One of the best laptops that I've owned
customer_reviews.text: One of the best laptops that I've owned. Design is awesome - as thin as it gets. Weighs nothing and really great performance. (I just hope that Win10 is an improvement over the current dog that Microsoft is having us walk). I would buy this laptop over and over again. I love using it - that's saying something for this crusty old MS Dos fan.
customer_reviews.author: Tridacna

customer_reviews.title: So quite
customer_reviews.text: Love this Zenbook. It is so quite, it is efficient for everyday tasks. I also have trouble staying connects to certain wi-fi. Noticed it only on campuses (noticed it on two university campuses in two different states, both of which I've never had problems with connecting to internet before this book). The battery life has been great, I've had it for 6 months. I will definitely be shopping for a solid state drive computer when it comes time to make my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KK13

customer_reviews.title: A very good machine for most workloads.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good laptop. It very lightweight, the battery lasts long enough, monitor is good, speakers are maybe a bit quite but otherwise normal-quality. Internal storage is SSD based, so very fast, and it will boot very quickly. Bought one for family, no complaints. I like how the CPU is very low-power but still more than fast enough for bursty workloads as typical of desktop usage. Maybe it's not good for gaming or computationally heavy tasks like video processing but otherwise it's almost perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lanugo

customer_reviews.title: Beware correct receipt for rebate
customer_reviews.text: The computer is fine. Upgraded to Win10, no problem. Only thing missing, that wouls have been nice, is a slot for a computer lock. One nit to pick - Asus rejected my rebate submission because the amazon.com invoice didn't say "final details." So I have to resubmit it. Rebates shouldn't require mail-in paperwork. They should be automatic with amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the performance of this Zenbook
customer_reviews.text: I've been working on it for the last 3 months now. The first thing I did before using it was to wipe out Windows, and install Ubuntu 14.04, which works quite well apart from slight glitches like brightness controls etc, which can be easily fixed with suggestions from Ubuntu forums. It's very light, sleek and professional looking, with a good size keyboard. It's easy portability more than makes up for the 4 hour battery life. There are no fans, so it's not noisy. It came with an ethernet to USB cable and adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Vimes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect low cost laptop if connectivity was not an issue
customer_reviews.text: This computer, for the current price, seems to be great. I was unable to connect to my home WI-FI router (Belkin Pre-N). I was able to connect through the Ethernet wire and my WI-FI hotspot on IPhone though. I called the tech support at ASUS. They tried a few things but the connectivity issue was not resolved. I must say that the wait time for the tech support was surprising short. Unfortunately, I had to return the computer as I did not want to take a chance on WI-FI connectivity when I am on the road.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return it
customer_reviews.text: So overrated. The only benefit of this machine is the SSD. Otherwise, not nearly enough memory to complete daily tasks, regular updates, or anything productive. Screen quality is lacking. Sound isn’t loud enough. Touchpad issues from day one.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: would be great if keyboard lighted and usable speakers installed
customer_reviews.text: would be great if keyboard lighted and usable speakers installed. Can't downgrade for these deficiencies. I knew about them before I purchased. Outstanding features: thin, LIGHT, excellent aluminum skin, good battery life, update to Windows 10 was free and it worked well. Downside: initial set up took me hours although I have never set up a Windows machine before.
customer_reviews.author: robert sherman

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow that thing is super annoying. Almost so annoying that I considered returning ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for in a light, thin laptop. The only issue I experienced, which seems common among reviewers, is the touchpad. Holy cow that thing is super annoying. Almost so annoying that I considered returning this, but then decided to just get a basic wireless mouse. Now the computer works great, super easy setup, really lightweight. Definitely buy a wireless mouse if you're buying this laptop, or else you might pull your hair out.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Batdorf

customer_reviews.title: Great, speedy computer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer for everyday small business needs. It is extremely thin and very lightweight. Even with its portability, it has a very solid build and great typing performance. It has also performed flawlessly with media I've used. The only downside I see is the battery. The battery life is exceptional for overall continual use, but unfortunately the battery drains even when the computer is in sleep mode. In other words, you will have to recharge multiple times a week even with minor sporadic use.
customer_reviews.author: Gannon Peters

customer_reviews.title: Love so many things about this laptop except
customer_reviews.text: Love so many things about this laptop except...what I knew I'd miss - the light-up keyboard AND it gets very hot sometimes while working on it. One other thing - which I read about in reviews is that the video goes out and has to reset randomly. It only takes seconds to reboot the video, but it's still annoying. LOVE the size, weight, keyboard. And once I figured out how to put files on the D:drive, I have plenty of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amy J.

customer_reviews.title: Junk and NO customer service to back it up
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of junk. After just a few months, the display randomly started cutting out, the computer will randomly shut off, and I lose everything I was working on. Making this worse, this company has the absolute WORST customer service. I have spent several hours on the phone with them attempting to troubleshoot, and nothing has worked. Now they want me to send back the computer I use everyday so they can evaluate it. That could take weeks. I also have a monitor from them that just crapped out, too. Don't do it. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: JLIJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice machine and excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice machine and excellent value. Starts up quickly, processor speed and memory is good enough for my needs. I'm horrified that Asus didn't coat the surface of the machine with something to prevent finger marks everywhere!?! I also had some very strange startup problems with my machine where it sometimes randomly couldn't find my desktop items - and also could not install the Simplified Chinese language pack. Although to be fair, that's very likely a Windows 8.1 issue. I also had my display driver fail a few times for a few seconds where my screen will just go black!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: input is iffy
customer_reviews.text: This machine definitely offers a lot at the price. A lot of fingerprints! Pros: Lots of storage and memory (at price range). It is very fast though and great for what I need it. Can VMware a simple Linux desktop just fine. Cons: the touchpad being so big and iffy. Sometimes it gets confused when you've rested a finger on the clicker and the other is moving around the right shift key's sensor isn't always activated. i tend to get my pinky on the very edge of it and that's almost never a good spot. it's said that wifi range isn't great, but it is still better than an iphone5's :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Linux Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I will continue to sing the praises of the Asus Zenbook. I liked this laptop so much, I bought a second for my significant other. For the cost, the specs are great. The Linux support for this laptop is almost unmatched. If you install ubuntu on this machine, everything works immediately! I've noticed some hardware oddities from time to time, but nothing consistent. The sound on this laptop is not that great, however, but that's to be expected for this form factor. If you're interested in a sleek, powerful, and light Linux laptop, I'd go for the Asus any day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience ever
customer_reviews.text: Screen has failed after 6 months of usage. A great machine otherwise, but now I am going to have to 1) return the laptop and hope that it gets fixed and 2) have the knowledge that this machine does not stand up to the demands of daily use. I never dropped the machine and I carry a Lenovo as well. The Lenovo has had the same treatment and works fine. Two weeks later an Asus still has no estimated repair date. I made other arrangements and they can't even give me a date to return my broken machine. This as to be the worst purchase experience I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: After 4 years, this laptop is still amazing. Still runs like it did when I purchased it. I have always liked Asus. Not the greatest in sound but that wasn't one of the specialty's. Would definitely look into another once this one no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Moore

customer_reviews.title: Issue with Display Driver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop which is very slim and lightweight but since I bought it, it has presented a problem with a the screen. The issue is that while I'm working on my laptop the screen suddenly turns black for a few seconds and then it returns to normal, and a small message pops up saying the following: "Display driver stopped responding and has recovered. Display Driver Intel HD graphics Drivers for Windows 8(R) stopped responding and has successfully recovered". This happens every day between 1-5 times per day. I have called technical support several times for help but they haven't been able to solve this defect. It's been a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: - Looks super slick. Very thin laptop - Has enough power ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Looks super slick. Very thin laptop - Has enough power to do everything I need it to. Pretty fast computer - Boots up super quickly Cons: - Battery life is not at all what is advertised. I get maybe 5 hours out of this on power-saver mode - Wi-fi adaptor isn't great. My iPhone was able to connect to signals that this computer couldn't. Not sure if this is a Windows 10 software issue or a hardware issue - No ethernet outlet. So when wi-fi doesn't connect, you're screwed
customer_reviews.author: Neel P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang For Buck In Regards to Performance And Build
customer_reviews.text: This ultrabook is awesome. It is definitely a lot faster than I expected it to be. Especially for everyday tasks such as browsing, media consumption, etc. It can surprisingly run very light games as well, which is a huge plus. At this price point, it is definitely worth the great mobility it brings to the table in addition to the good build quality and overall performance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Magcalas

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for Ubuntu 14.04
customer_reviews.text: This is my first week with the Zenbook and I absolutely love it. I have been running Ubuntu on a range of laptops for several years, and I would have to say this has been my most pleasant experience so far. Installed Ubuntu 14.04 without issue, with only the screen brightness as the issue -- which this fixed:  The laptop is sleek, light, and works perfectly for working on the bus. It is the best Ubuntu Laptop I have ever worked on and is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan Berg

customer_reviews.title: I have not had an issue with that other than it is just a bit annoying. All in all I do enjoy this laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop when I began a doctorate program recently. It is very lightweight and sleek and very fast but honestly there is something holding me back from giving it 5 stars. I have had a few occurrences where my screen will go black and a pop up will say that a driver crashed and has been recovered. I have not had an issue with that other than it is just a bit annoying. All in all I do enjoy this laptop a lot and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay C

customer_reviews.title: Shut Down Without Charger
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, I loved this laptop and thought it would be perfect for me. After 1 week, I was still pretty content but during the next week, it began to randomly shut off. I did a little research and found out that this was a problem several other owners experienced. I wanted to continue working with the Zenbook because I loved its sleek design but I decided to return it after it wouldn't stay powered on without a charger. If Asus could fix this serious glitch, I would be more than willing to purchase this laptop but I think that this experience has turned me off the Asus brand.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Agyemang

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: Coming from Apple products I didn't expect much out of this laptop. The build quality is almost on par with my old Macbook Air, only things I miss are the mag safe adapter, glass touchpad and backlit keyboard, although the keyboard on the asus is nicer to type on for my taste. Zero noise due to it's fanless design and runs much cooler than I expected. Processor has been pegged at 2ghz turbo mode since I booted it up due to updates, etc and it's still running cooler than the mac it replaced. Hat off to ASUS for a well sorted product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing laptop. It's so small and thin
customer_reviews.text: Amazing laptop. It's so small and thin, but it doesn't feel flimsy or weak at all. It's nice and sturdy, and it doesn't overheat when I'm using it, even if I have multiple browser windows open or I'm using photoshop. The screen is the perfect size, and the keyboard is very nice to type with. The keys stick out just the right amount, it's well spaced, and it feels nice to type. The body of the laptop is also gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Altier

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had one for three years. It's only been a couple months since it started acting up. Now it won't connect to any internet, freezes all the time, won't load programs.... I think it's on its last legs. But it was an amazing computer for three years, and it did what I needed it too. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Seanelope

customer_reviews.title: Third time's a charm?
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first two I received. The first one appeared to have a bad processor or something. It ran extremely slowly and maxed out at 0.49Ghz. The second one locked up every hour or so. So far the third one is working. I use this laptop for my small business and it doesn't lag at all. It's perfectly snappy for using the internet and MS Office.
customer_reviews.author: Microondas

customer_reviews.title: ... been using it for a few weeks and I love it. It's very fast and was easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for a few weeks and I love it. It's very fast and was easy to set up. The picture is beautiful. Not a ton of storage space but what do you expect from such a lightweight and elegant laptop? Also don't love the speakers, they are a little quiet but not a problem if you use headphones. Otherwise it's a great computer for the price and the battery lasts very long.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P. Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: and it was fine for about 12 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought the laptop in April 15, and it was fine for about 12 months. As soon as the one year warranty expired (2 days post expiration), the space bar decided to quit on me. Called Asus and they advised to mail in the laptop for repairs at my expense. According to the ship to address, that place is about 5 min away from my work. Asked if I can just drop it off, flat out refused by ASUS. The keyboard appeared to be cheaply made, never another ASUS product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zenbook UX305FA Wifi Defect
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to test and see if they could replace our aging fleet of laptops. If it were not for the extremely erratic touch pad, and the bad Intel 7265 Wifi nic, this machine would have been a perfect fit. I put in service tickets with both Asus and Intel on the nic problem. The work around to get it to connect to my (46) WPA2 access points was to manually set the driver to use 802.11b mode only. Note that every other WPA2 device on the planet can connect to our wireless network. Battery life and form factor of this machine are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Paperless Society

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Capabilities Disappear Every Few Days/No WiFi Adapter Detected
customer_reviews.text: Having to knock this down to one star. Drivers for WiFi adapter kept dropping out, so for a bout a week I kept having to reinstall them. Now the WiFi adapter isn't even being detected by the computer. A waste of time and money, and there is no helpful information out there beyond software issues. Seems I got a bad egg of a computer/WiFi adapter and I can't even send it back... I am super pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L.

customer_reviews.title: ... not turn on with the power button (same symptoms like another customer posted in reviews)
customer_reviews.text: Computer does not turn on with the power button (same symptoms like another customer posted in reviews), even the led charging light does not turn on its, only 10 months passed after I bought this notebook. Bad experience when talking with ASUS Tech customer service, literally they ended and shut down, in my face the chat screen while I was typing for more help. I didn't receive from ASUS a good treatment or any option than can make happy or satisfied client. Horrible customer service. Think twice!
customer_reviews.author: EEB.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I really like this laptop. The touch screen is super convenient and it's decently lightweight and has a good battery life. The main issue I've been having with this laptop is that whenever I turn it back on from sleep mode, the touchscreen goes all crazy and presses random spots on the screen. Sometimes it even distorts the images on the screen and it will often make any sound that is playing into a 3 second screech. Once it's done throwing a tantrum it works perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee Hammond

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Broke twice within the first 60 days. Problem with the battery interface with the charging cord. Needs to be shipped back to ASUS, and I will be buying my college student a replacement since she can't wait three weeks on the repair. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is bar-none the best laptop I've owned. The resolution is in that perfect sweet spot. The weight is great. The keyboard stays clean. I backpacked south america on a motorcycle, with this as my laptop during those months. It never disappointed, and continues to serve me in the software dev world of my career nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Lambdanaut

customer_reviews.title: The laptop was very nice. My old laptop was an Asus so I ...
customer_reviews.text: The laptop was very nice. My old laptop was an Asus so I was going to stick to that brand. I liked how thin and light it was, but it would not keep the wifi settings. I kept having to reload the wifi adapter. It was very frustrating. I ended up returning it and getting a Dell.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGirl

customer_reviews.title: horrible connecting to wireless internet
customer_reviews.text: Does anyone else have serious issues with this computer connecting to wireless routers? I want to like this computer but it won't connect with half of the wireless networks I come across. I'm very close to sending it back after wasting hours of my life trying to fix it with no answers found on any of the support forums
customer_reviews.author: J&N-S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery life, good display, and surprisingly capable for such a thin, lightweight notebook. On the downside, the touchpad could do with some serious improvement, and it comes with a rather large amount of bloatware pre-installed, which is annoying since the Microsoft store offers the same device without it, for the same price. Overall, an excellent value though.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brown

customer_reviews.title: utility is good, boot time is top notch
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Compact, sleek, capable. Not for gamers or those running multiple resource intense programs at the same time. Two major areas of deficiencies are volume output and keyboard. Few of my keys are slanted after repeated use (F4 key) The volume output is minor issue for me as I purchased this as a mobile unit and I tend to carry headphones with me. Overall, utility is good, boot time is top notch, and half the price of Apple's air book. Worth the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Klee

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for about 3 weeks. I am a college student and use this baby for 5+ hours a day and it has exceeded my expectations. Battery life is great, keyboard is comfortable, processor is sufficient, looks beautiful (people have complimented on how thin it is, comparing it to a Macbook air). There is nothing flashy about this computer, it's a solid computer that will get the day to day tasks done with no problems. I love it and would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite thing I own
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite thing I own! Really the only laptop I could take from work to home every day. I have nothing but love for the functionality of this laptop - the only minor issue I have is that even with speakers at their maximum the volume is quite low. You won't regret this purchase for portability, functionality, and aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Longoria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what a laptop was meant for. Fanless Broadwell ultrabook.
customer_reviews.text: Not by any means a gaming rig, but a solid performer, runs Manga Studio 5 pro like a champ, great battery life, and no fans to go bad and fry your motherboard from the heat. The back warms up to a nice heating-pad temperature, but that's a plus to me; I'm cold natured and can use a little extra heat. It will play modded minecraft with optifine and 25 or so mods at 30-45 FPS. Gimp does'nt run so well but is adequate until I can get to my heavy lifter desktop PC.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Move on...Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second laptop that I have received. The first one had a bad hard drive so I had to return it. The one I have now also has the same problem and is showing me a screen that states that my PC needs to be repaired. This is RIDICULOUS! After researching and making a decision based off of this units rave reviews, I feel totally irritated at having 2 new laptops that do not work. Do not buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn  Berg

customer_reviews.title: I love the size and the computer
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and the computer, but the trackpad doesn't work well if the computer isn't on a hard surface. It can run a little slow at times, but is a good computer for the most part. I still use it in 2018.
customer_reviews.author: karina

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Liked it while it lasted, great battery life but now exactly one month after the warranty expired it won't boot. Very disappointed. Cant get any online support from ASUS.com as even though it is registered the site crashes. 13 months life for PC is completely unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: cjones3

customer_reviews.title: Runs games like TF2 fine and Civ V OK but overheats
customer_reviews.text: Solid laptop for the price but display drive often crashes (fixes itself on restart) and touchpad stopped working after 6 months so I use a plug in USB mouse. Runs games like TF2 fine and Civ V OK but overheats.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: It was such a good laptop that
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife and she loves it. It was such a good laptop that, on my recommendation 3 other friends have bought this (and the next gen version) and they all love it. I only wish there was more Hackintosh community support for it, so I could buy one to do my work on.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Barrett

customer_reviews.title: I love the weight
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight...so light! No issues with the pad being sensitive, I don't think it's different than any other laptop that I've used, so I'm not sure what other reviewers are referring to. Easy to set up and use. I would highly recommend this laptop! All positive.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. Neat and sturdy. Using MS Office, Sage Accounting Software and Skype - have had no problems. The battery life is good and I love the instant gratification from solid state memory. (No extended waiting while the system boots) Yes the memory storage is limited, but slim external hard disks are pretty inexpensive. I have not missed the lack of touch screen and the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Marfleet

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It just arrived today and so far everything is great. I'm having a little trouble installing Windows 10 though. The first attempt failed due to some obscure update I was missing. I went to the Asus website and downloaded the Windows 10 upgrade directly from the website. So far so good. It's almost downloaded but I have burned through the better part of the day doing this! Hope it works! May have to revise this rating however if the second attempt isn't successful.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a high school or college student
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design, lightweight, and decent processing speed. Gets the job done if you're just using it for school. I'm pretty clumsy, but this laptop stands up to a lot of damage despite being so thin.
customer_reviews.author: KiRee Robinson

customer_reviews.title: First class machine - excellent screen; nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am using the ASUS to create this review. First class machine - excellent screen; nice keyboard; fast enough for anything you probably need it for and wonderfully slim. Only upgrade I would like would be a back lit keyboard. 1/2 the price of an equivalent MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, no regrets with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a loyal apple user; however, doing excel work on a Mac is rather difficult. I needed a laptop that wasn't overly expensive, lightweight and did not crash with multiple excel tabs open. This laptop does the job! I highly recommend this laptop to those who want a versatile laptop that can easily be carried around during commutes. Only problem is the track pad...I've had better, but still can't complain for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Radovan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money - highly-rated specs!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for well over a year and it still works as smoothly as day one. Super fast processor, zero lag-time, sleek and seamless design.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Liu

customer_reviews.title: it's super light, battery life is great
customer_reviews.text: it's super light, battery life is great. i've repeatedly had video card issues though: it blacks out randomly- hopefully will get resolved with tech support.
customer_reviews.author: ms4student

customer_reviews.title: Really good for students!
customer_reviews.text: A very good laptop for the typical college student. I take this to class with ease. It makes no awkward loud noises! Super light and thin and can fit in any bag. I want the white one to come out so I can get it for my girlfriend!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great System
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful system. It works perfect, with this system and one of the newer large screen cellphones, one doesn't need a tablet. The system is very fast, with the SSD and extremely light. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I had a great Asus before, but this lighter, sleeker one isn't as reliable. I've had it three years, and from the beginning the display would periodically go dark for a few seconds. In the last year it stopped connecting to wifi consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love this laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this laptop. The light weight is great to carry. I had reservations about Windows 8, but it is working for us. It is very fast to respond. The screen size is easy to view.
customer_reviews.author: JudyM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months using this laptop, the wireless adapter stopped working. Look at the forums on web and you will see that this is a common problem. I tried everything possible to fix it, updated all drivers, contacted Asus support (which is terrible), and I keep having problems. I really do not recommend this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome, like a 1/2 price MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, like a 1/2 price MacBook Air. Note that ConsumerReports thinks ASUS reliability is poor enough for them not to recommend it. After 4 months, I've had no problems. I'm basically using it as a dumb terminal (via TeamViewer) to be able to wander around work and operate my desktop machine. So I can't comment on the processor performance. Screen is nice. I do get 8+ hours of battery time usually.
customer_reviews.author: inNC

customer_reviews.title: Pros - Pretty light laptop with nice design features
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Pretty light laptop with nice design features, battery life last pretty long. Con - Speakers are weak even at maximum volume, Light is a bit dim even at max lighting and resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Sexy little laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, this is a sexy looking laptop. It won't break any speed records, but it is super thin and light. Easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Alton

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight at a good price. However
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight at a good price. However, you will probably want some peripheral devices/cables (ethernet connection, video output, DVD R/W device, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Light, Fast, Quiet, and Cool
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to deal with Windows 8 (not ASUS' fault), I love this machine. Reminds me a lot of my MacBook Air I had to give up, except quieter (no fan). Screen size is plenty big enough to get work done, and serves up shows on Hulu just fine. I will say the speakers are not very loud and a little tinny, but I never expect anything from laptop speakers and use something else when I care about sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty much the bigger version of the Zenphone 2
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much the bigger version of the Zenphone 2, and that's not a bad thing. Like how the Zenphone 2 is like a cheaper somewhat better iphone replacement. This is like a cheaper better Mac-book air. I highly recommend buying this laptop for web browsing and possibly light light gaming, like mine craft maybe. All in all a great laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Black

customer_reviews.title: Everything else is just great.
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna give it five stars, but then I heard the headphone output, irritable is the word that comes to mind. Everything else is just great. I continued to listen to it, and I think that it got better, or I just got used to it
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love the slim size and excellent screen resolution. The mouse is a little touchy and changes screens sometimes when I don't intend it to. Not as easy to navigate as a Macbook Pro, but definitely worth the thousands in savings. Battery life not as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hofsess

customer_reviews.title: Champ For Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work. I run large excel files, power points and so on. It boots up in seconds, every time. SECONDS. No noise, no hum, the only slowness I experience is on from the internet not keeping up. Aesthetically pleasing, but the FN shortcuts are different then older models. Once I had the muscle memory to use them though, it is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Tulloch

customer_reviews.title: I said spend all your money on a good laptop and then plug it into your monitor and ...
customer_reviews.text: got it for my sister who wanted a cheep laptop and desktop. I said spend all your money on a good laptop and then plug it into your monitor and keyboard when you want to. she loves being mobile so much she never does that.
customer_reviews.author: pohlcat01

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for Ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, this computer has been amazing! A best buy for a modestly-priced ultrabook. Very fast to boot up, keyboard is best I have used for this sort of device, and screen is magnificent with rich colors. If you are looking for a reasonably-priced laptop with SSD (and you do want SSD; trust me!), you should definitely consider this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Short Life Sucks
customer_reviews.text: 14 Months of use and the Laptop is toast. I really liked it until I got the blue screen of death. ASUS wants 1/2 the price of the laptop to bring it back to life.... Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid laptop. Not high performance (to be fair, ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid laptop. Not high performance (to be fair, CPU is quite slow), but SSD and plenty of ram make it decent for internet/office/web development needs. Coolest part is that it's completely silent (no fans), yet I have not seen it overheating or performance throttling. Occasionally locks up but I blame Linux drivers for that. Other than that, Fedora works perfectly there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop!! Very happy overall. It is very thin and very lightweight. Would have given it 5 stars but the WIFI really needs to be improved. It frequently drops or needs to be rebooted to connect. I work in IT so the WIFI review is from a professional perspective.
customer_reviews.author: David Y

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Can only say that I'm fully satisfied with the laptop! Can't be bothered with the clicking sounds since you can simply double tap so no worries about that. Other than that it's a perfect laptop: fast, reliable and good looking. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Yarik

customer_reviews.title: Nice Linux Book
customer_reviews.text: Running ubuntu on it, installed quickly and haven't had much problem using the laptop at all. The backlight doesn't work out of the box with ubuntu, but xbacklight and keybinds can fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Battery life way lower than stated!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this laptop, but the 10 hour battery life is simply a lie. My Asus is brand new, but the battery drains in about 4-5 hours. I don't even do high consumption things like video and sound.
customer_reviews.author: FY

customer_reviews.title: great Ultra book
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Ultra book. I gave it four stars because I am still getting use to the 13.3 inch size. Otherwise the laptop is starts very quickly and is very responsive. At this time I have no problems with the device. I have used it for two months now.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty25

customer_reviews.title: Just great
customer_reviews.text: Love it to death. Amazingly fast. Sound is not very strong but I use headphones or Bluetooth speaker all the time either way.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Flores Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design. All aluminum case with 2
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. All aluminum case with 2.6 pounds light weight. Intel M processor, 8GB memory, 1600LDR are just as same as the all new designed MacBook. The HD display looks ok, not as sharp as retina display. No back light keyboard, that's the only thing I dislike. Besides that, everything is just way more worth than the price you're gonna pay.
customer_reviews.author: Xiao

customer_reviews.title: Great for price, but has some issues.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Fast, slim, light, pricing is fair, battery life is amazing (up to 10 hrs). Cons: Video card crashes every now and then (others seem to have this issue), sometimes the turbo for the process doesn't work and the speed is limited at 1 Ghz (restarting always seem to solve the issue).
customer_reviews.author: redraccoon

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and doesn't seem to heat up too bad when used for long intervals
customer_reviews.text: Use it for web browsing, day trading, and for small amounts of video editing for school. Very lightweight and doesn't seem to heat up too bad when used for long intervals. Will deff get another Asus product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Joseph

customer_reviews.title: and awesome to travel with
customer_reviews.text: This computer is lightweight, fast, and awesome to travel with. I've been using it for just over a year and haven't had any issues with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Gestido

customer_reviews.title: Handy little devil!
customer_reviews.text: Great little laptop! The 13-inch screen and light weight make this laptop handy as the devil.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wykes

customer_reviews.title: Good computer!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this laptop for about a month now, and I have no major complaints so far. The sleek design is perfect for carrying around all day. I also love the "matte" screen, which makes it easy to read things on my computer outdoors or near a window.
customer_reviews.author: lizardbajema

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good and slim. I expect a little more on performance!
customer_reviews.author: Jacklin S.

customer_reviews.text: Insane fast start up, great power through running and starting programs, and very lightweight yet durable and solid feeling. I guess the only thing I would change is how many fingerprints there are on the top but that's literally nothing compared to the rest of the pros. *****
customer_reviews.author: Grant Gaspar

product_meta.title: ASUS Zenbook UX305FA-ASM1 Laptop (Windows 8.1, Intel 5th Gen Core M-5Y10 0.8GHz, 13" LED-lit Screen, Storage: 256 GB, RAM: 8 GB) Grey
product_meta.description:
ASUS Zenbook UX305FA-ASM1 Intel Core M-5Y10 (800MHz - 2.0GHz) Processor, 13.3" Full HD (1920 x 1080) IPS Display, 8GB DDR3 1600MHz Memory, 256GB Solid State Drive (SSD), Intel HD Graphics 5300, Microsoft Windows 10 (64-bit)

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 256 GB Solid State Drive. 8 GB RAM
Designed to be ultra-slim with an all-aluminum body

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars846 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
